questions.name: Exercise 1.2.1
questions.question:
Let \( \mathbf{p} = (5, 5) \) and \( \mathbf{q} = (1, -7) \).
a. Determine \( \mathbf{p} + \mathbf{q} \) and \( \mathbf{p} - \mathbf{q} \).
b. Represent \( \mathbf{p}, \mathbf{q}, \mathbf{p} + \mathbf{q}, \) and \( \mathbf{p} - \mathbf{q} \) by arrows in a parallelogram.
c. Compute \( |\mathbf{p}|, |\mathbf{q}|, |\mathbf{p} + \mathbf{q}|, \) and \( |\mathbf{p} - \mathbf{q}| \).
d. Is \( |\mathbf{p} + \mathbf{q}|^2 = |\mathbf{p}|^2 + |\mathbf{q}|^2 \) ?

questions.name: Exercise 1.2.2
questions.question:
Let \( \mathbf{p} = (2, -2, 1) \) and \( \mathbf{q} = (2, 3, 2) \).
Show that \( |\mathbf{p} + \mathbf{q}|^2 = |\mathbf{p}|^2 + |\mathbf{q}|^2 \) and \( |\mathbf{p} - \mathbf{q}|^2 = |\mathbf{p}|^2 + |\mathbf{q}|^2 \).
Interpret geometrically.

questions.name: Exercise 1.2.3
questions.question:
Let \( P, Q, \) and \( R \) be the vertices of a triangle in \( \mathbb{R}^2 \) or \( \mathbb{R}^3 \).
Use vectors to show that the line segment joining the midpoints of any two sides of the triangle is parallel to and one half the length of the third side. (Note: two vectors are parallel if and only if one is a scalar multiple of the other.)

questions.name: Exercise 1.2.4
questions.question: Find the angle between the vectors \( \mathbf{p} = (-2, 4) \) and \( \mathbf{q} = (3, -5) \).

questions.name: Exercise 1.2.5
questions.question: Find the angle between the vectors \( \mathbf{p} = (1, -2, 4) \) and \( \mathbf{q} = (3, 5, 2) \).

questions.name: Exercise 1.2.6
questions.question: Find six different nonobtuse angles between various nonparallel diagonals of the unit cube (defined in Exercise 1.1.4) and between its edges and diagonals.

questions.name: Exercise 1.2.7
questions.question:
The line segments joining the centers of the faces of the unit cube form a regular octahedron.
Find the angles between its various edges, and try to draw it.

questions.name: Exercise 1.2.8
questions.question:
Consider a triangle in the \( xy \) plane with vertices \( A = (1, 3), B = (2, 4), \) and \( C = (4, -1) \).
a. the orthogonal projection of \( \mathbf{p} = \overrightarrow{AB} \) onto the line of \( \mathbf{q} = \overrightarrow{BC} \),
b. the distance of \( A \) from that line, and
c. the area of the triangle.

questions.name: Exercise 1.2.9
questions.question: Decompose the vector \( \mathbf{p} = (2, -3, 1) \) into components parallel and perpendicular to the vector \( \mathbf{q} = (12, 3, 4) \).

questions.name: Exercise 1.2.10
questions.question:
Prove the parallelogram law for the length: \( |\mathbf{p} + \mathbf{q}|^2 + |\mathbf{p} - \mathbf{q}|^2 = 2|\mathbf{p}|^2 + 2|\mathbf{q}|^2 \) for all vectors in \( \mathbb{R}^n \).
Interpret geometrically!
